channel.title: Anyone here had experience with depression?
channel.description:
Yoh.. so anyway my mate got diagnosed with depression he says (personally I believe him but others don't) and they all don't seem to think he's being serious saying stuff like "man up" and shit, but you don't have to be a doctor to know depression is a bit more serious than a little downer.
Anyway, just wondering if any of you have had depression; what helps?

item.title: Anyone here had experience with depression?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Shouldn’t use psychoactive drugs to cover up the effects of depression.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone here had experience with depression?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Basically different parts of your brain will ‘light up’ when in use. When 2 or more parts light up at the same time, they start to associate with each other and light up automatically.

This is how ‘practice makes perfect’ and muscle memory works.

If you’re in a sad mood and then turn on the tv, these parts of your brain will light up. Do it enough times and whenever you turn on the tv you get depressed. Obviously it can work with every action you do, which leads into a downward spiral.

The obvious way to break this is to think positive, which is cliche but it works. Put out good things and make a note of them, no matter how ridiculous. Then the brain starts associating the actions with happy thoughts and overwrites the old ones.

That’s how I got over depression without meds after having it for years.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone here had experience with depression?

item.title: Anyone here had experience with depression?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

lol, so many retarded answers

i would suggest that if he really wants to help himself he at least give CBT a go, especially if he lives in a country with a decent health service and can get it cheap/free

with a proper trained practitioner that is, not self help

if he has doubts about “therapy”, point out that its not traditional whackjob “talk about your childhood” shit, its designed to be pragmatic and non-fluff

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone here had experience with depression?

item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:1, topic:338501”]Yoh… so anyway my mate got diagnosed with depression he says (personally I believe him but others don’t) and they all don’t seem to think he’s being serious saying stuff like “man up” and shit, but you don’t have to be a doctor to know depression is a bit more serious than a little downer.

Anyway, just wondering if any of you have had depression; what helps?[/quote]

to take the question seriously, he needs to regain his self confidence. find a reason to be confident. i know that is vague but it makes a big difference. maybe get a girl to go on a date with him. younger guys will get an INSTANT self esteem boost on that one
